meanings.definition: To drive away or urge to move by or as if by crying "shoo"
meanings.sent1: The farmer was shooing the birds from his crops.
meanings.sent2: She was shooing the stray cat out of her garden.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was shooing away imaginary monsters with her toy wand.
meanings.sent4: The loud music was shooing away her thoughts of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The scarecrow was shooing the crows with its flapping arms.

meanings.definition: To cause to move, leave, or go away by or as if by crying "shoo"
meanings.sent1: The dog was shooing the squirrel up the tree.
meanings.sent2: The mother was shooing her children out of the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The wind was shooing the leaves in playful circles.
meanings.sent4: The bright light was shooing away the shadows in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was shooing the students to their seats before the bell rang.
